content:
That's a great plan! Grabbing coffee is a low-key way to catch up, and it'll give you both a chance to chat about photography and your interests.

As for asking David to bring his camera gear, I think that's a wonderful idea! Many photographers love sharing their knowledge and passion with others, and David might be more than happy to show you his gear and give you a quick rundown on how to use it.

Just be respectful of his time and equipment, and ask politely if he'd be willing to bring some of his gear to show you. You could say something like:

"Hey David, I've been really interested in photography lately and I was wondering if you'd be willing to bring some of your camera gear to our coffee meetup? I'd love to learn more about your setup and get some tips from you."

By asking politely and showing genuine interest, I'm sure David will be happy to oblige. Just remember to be mindful of his equipment and don't expect him to teach you everything in one session. This is a great opportunity to learn from him and get a feel for photography, but also to reconnect with your friend.
